adjectives.description: incoherent (comparative more incoherent, superlative most incoherent)

entries.meaning: Not making logical sense; not logically connected or consistent.
examples: When we confronted her, she gave us a hasty, incoherent explanation.
After just a few drinks, he becomes incoherent.

entries.meaning: (obsolete) Not holding together physically; loose; unconnected.
examples: […]  Some hasty and undigested Thoughts, on a Subject I had never before considered, which I set down against our next Meeting, gave the first entrance into this Discourse, which having been thus begun by Chance, was continued by Intreaty; written by incoherent parcels; and, after long intervals of neglect, resum'd again, as my Humour or Occasions permitted; and at last, in a retirement, where an Attendence on my Health gave me leisure, it was brought into that order thou now seest it.
At this stage the labourers still form an incoherent mass scattered over the whole country, and broken up by their mutual competition.
